text: The East Lancs Myllennium was a single-decker body of a bus. It had a low- floor. It was built from 1999 to 2006 by East Lancashire Coachbuilders. It was built on the DAF SB220 chassis, Dennis Dart SLF chassis (photo), MAN 14.220 chassis and Scania OmniTown chassis. East Lancs misspelled bus names on purpose (naming it "Myllennium" instead of "Millennium") In 2006, It was replaced by the East Lancs EsteemNew single-deck from East Lancs Bus & Coach Professional 7 February 2006New Esteem single-deck from East Lancs Bus & Coach Professional 13 April 2006 ==Hyline== The East Lancs Myllennium Hyline was a single-decker body of a bus. It was built from 2000 to 2002 by East Lancashire Coachbuilders. It was built on the Leyland Tiger chassis and Volvo B10M chassis. File:East Thames 42.jpg|East Thames Buses Scania N94UB with Myllennium bodywork in 2007 File:Bluestar 3351 rear.JPG|Bluestar Dennis Dart SLF with Myllennium bodywork in 2008 File:Tiger Line.jpg|Tiger Line Leyland Tiger with Myllennium Hyline bodywork in 2008 File:Bus img 7232 (16341904622).jpg|Tiger Line Leyland Tiger with Myllennium Hyline bodywork in 2008 ==Related pages== * For the double-deck body on DAF DB250 chassis, see East Lancs Myllennium Lowlander * For the double-deck body on Dennis Trident 2 chassis, see East Lancs Myllennium Lolyne * For the double-deck body on Volvo B7TL, see East Lancs Myllennium Vyking * For the double-deck body on Volvo B9TL, see East Lancs Myllennium Nordic ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:Low-floor buses Myllennium Category:Full-size buses
title: East Lancs Myllennium
